intro: Cymbalariella sibirica, commonly known as Siberian rock cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and Siberia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round pods that contain seeds. Cymbalariella sibirica is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
